job.name: PostgreSQL
job.description: Deployment of the PostgreSQL Database server. This workflow requires the following third-party credential: {key: posgres://<postgres_username>@<postgres_instance_name>, value: POSTGRES_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials.

task.name: Start_PostgreSQL
task.description: Pull PostgreSQL image and start a container

script.code:
printf "Pulling postgre image \n" docker pull activeeon/postgres
CONTAINER=$variables_POSTGRES_INSTANCE_NAME_CL POSTGRES_DATABASE=$variables_POSTGRES_DATABASE_CL POSTGRES_USER=$variables_POSTGRES_USER_CL POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$variables_POSTGRES_PASSWORD_CL
if [ -z "$CONTAINER" ]; then CONTAINER=$variables_POSTGRES_INSTANCE_NAME fi
if [ -z "$POSTGRES_DATABASE" ]; then POSTGRES_DATABASE=$variables_POSTGRES_DATABASE fi
if [ -z "$POSTGRES_USER" ] && [ ! -z "$variables_POSTGRES_USER" ]; then POSTGRES_USER=$variables_POSTGRES_USER fi if [ -z "$POSTGRES_USER" ]; then POSTGRES_USER="postgres" fi
if [ -z "$POSTGRES_PASSWORD" ]; then POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$variables_POSTGRES_PASSWORD fi
echo POSTGRES_INSTANCE_NAME = "$CONTAINER" echo POSTGRES_DATABASE = "$POSTGRES_DATABASE" echo POSTGRES_USER = "$POSTGRES_USER" echo POSTGRES_PASSWORD = "$POSTGRES_PASSWORD"
if [ -z "$POSTGRES_PASSWORD" ]; then echo ERROR: POSTGRES_PASSWORD cannot be empty. exit 1 fi
if [ "$(docker ps -a | grep $CONTAINER)" ]; then RUNNING=$(docker inspect --format="{{ .State.Running }}" $CONTAINER 2> /dev/null) STOPPED=$(docker inspect --format="{{ .State.Status }}" $CONTAINER 2> /dev/null)
if [ "$RUNNING" == "true" ]; then echo "$CONTAINER container is running" elif [ "$STOPPED" == "exited" ]; then echo "Starting $CONTAINER container" docker start $CONTAINER fi
else echo "Running $CONTAINER container" if [ "$POSTGRES_DATABASE" == null ] && [ "$POSTGRES_USER" == null ]; then docker run --name $CONTAINER -p 5432 -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$POSTGRES_PASSWORD -d activeeon/postgres -c 'listen_addresses=0.0.0.0' elif [ "$POSTGRES_DATABASE" == null ] && [ "$POSTGRES_USER" != null ]; then docker run --name $CONTAINER -p 5432 -e POSTGRES_USER=$POSTGRES_USER -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$POSTGRES_PASSWORD -d activeeon/postgres -c 'listen_addresses=0.0.0.0' elif [ "$POSTGRES_DATABASE" != null ] && [ "$POSTGRES_USER" == null ]; then docker run --name $CONTAINER -p 5432 -e POSTGRES_DATABASE=$POSTGRES_DATABASE -d activeeon/postgres -c 'listen_addresses=0.0.0.0' else docker run --name $CONTAINER -p 5432 -e POSTGRES_USER=$POSTGRES_USER -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$POSTGRES_PASSWORD -e POSTGRES_DB=$POSTGRES_DATABASE -d activeeon/postgres -c 'listen_addresses=0.0.0.0' fi
fi
port=$(docker inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "5432/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' $CONTAINER) echo "$port" > $CONTAINER"_port"
# Endpoint added to the job variables using a groovy post-script
